tweets.text:
üì¢JOB ALERTüì¢
Interested in #mortality #inequalities? Apply for this #PhD position @MPIDRnews with wonderful supervisors @ezagheni F. Janssen (@NIDI_KNAW) C.G. Camarda (@InedFr) & myself!! Application deadline March 20 #poptwitter @PopulationEU üëá
https://t.co/WhYxVgrWzW

NEW STUDY
Is the decline in first births in Finland related to changes in union patterns? Yes, to some extent. However, postponing or foregoing childbearing within unions represents the primary reason for the fertility decline in the 2010s.
https://t.co/fw1DHPQvnS https://t.co/gXcxd5LK6I

urls.title: Human Mortality Database
urls.description: The Human Mortality Database (HMD) is the world¬¥s leading scientific data resource on mortality in developed countries. The HMD provides detailed high-quality harmonized mortality and population estimates to researchers, students, journalists, policy analysts, and others interested in the human longevity. The HMD follows open data principles. Hong Kong revised and updated through 2020. To facilitate rapid downloads, the database has been organized into zipped data

tweets.text: I joined @IIPSMumbai as Professor in Public Health and Mortality Studies! A new chapter of life begins!

‚ÄúWe provide an in-depth description of family configurations in low- and middle-income countries, how they distribute across the globe, and how they change over time‚Äù, says @andres9886 about the recent paper published in Population, Space and Place 
https://t.co/aLEszDqeqP

üéâHeute feiern wir den Tag der Bibliotheken gleich doppelt!üéäüéä Genau wie unser Institut, wird auch unsere Bibliothek 25 Jahre alt. Und so sah es damals am ersten Standort aus: https://t.co/gX0SBLpvJc

I really enjoyed being part of discussions at the @MPIDRnews 25th birthday celebrations today. I wrote up a few thoughts about the future of data-driven demographic research here: https://t.co/TDwOKXj4kV

Pleasure to join @MPIDRnews on the occasion of their 25th anniversary & present @EU_Commission work on #DemographyEU, including #RuralVisionEU, #AgeingEU, #Loneliness, #BrainDrain & #EUChildRights. https://t.co/wytwm09jCs

üéâüéâWe are very much looking forward to celebrating 25 years of the MPIDR on Thursday.

We will have a panel discussion with @monjalexander @MKr9b Karl Ulrich Mayer, Mikko Myrskyl√§ and @ezagheni and much more. https://t.co/BypYd1NvSe

The inequality is enormous: Mothers in select African countries are more than 100 times more likely to have had a child die than mothers in high income countries, find @smithgreenaway @d_alburez @JTrinitapoli and @ezagheni in their recent @BMJ_Open paper 

https://t.co/YWK3WYFYnH
